sen.j: 平安初期に、催馬楽と、ほぼ同時に発生。
sen.e: In the early Heian period, roei was born almost at the same time as "saibara" (another Japanese court music in the Heian period).
sen.cmt: ここで”another”としたのは、後列にあるように、朗詠自身が雅楽のひとつだからです。

sen.j: 和漢朗詠集等からの漢詩に曲を付けたもの。
sen.e: Roei was the tunes set to the Chinese-style poems that were taken from some collections, including "Japanese-Chinese Recitation Collection."
Roei were tunes set to Chinese-style poems that were taken from some collections, including "Japanese-Chinese Recitation Collection."
sen.cmt: rewording
sen.e: Roei were tunes set to Chinese-style poems that were taken from some collections, including Wakan roei shu (Japanese and Chinese poems to sing).
sen.cmt: 和漢朗詠集 日本語の読みを追加しました。

sen.e: Generally, roei belongs to "gagaku" (ancient Japanese court music and dance).
Generally, roei belongs to gagaku (ancient Japanese court music and dance).

sen.j: 前半を「一の句」、後半を「二の句」と呼ぶ。
sen.e: The former half of roei is called "the first phrase," and the latter half is called "the second phrase."
The former half of roei is called "the first phrase," and the latter half is called "the second phrase."
sen.cmt: punctuation
sen.e: The former half of roei is called 'the first phrase,' and the latter half is called 'the second phrase.'
sen.cmt: " → ' としました。

sen.j: 一の句は低音(D3)位から発声するのに対し、二の句は高音(D4)位から発声する。
sen.e: The tone of the first phrase is around D3 (the tone D in the lower range), and that of the second phase is around D4 (the tone D in the higher range).
sen.cmt: 「D」は、「ドレミ」の音階のうち、「レ」に相当する音の英語表記です。（下記（*)を参照しました。）
